What is an EICR?

An Electrical Installation Condition Report (EICR) is a comprehensive inspection of your property's electrical systems. It identifies any defects, deterioration, or potential safety issues with your wiring, sockets, switches, and consumer unit.

The inspection covers the condition of electrical installations against the current version of the BS 7671 wiring regulations (18th Edition).

Who Needs an EICR?

Landlords (Legal Requirement)

Private rental properties must have a valid EICR renewed every 5 years, or upon change of tenancy if more than 5 years old.

Homeowners

Recommended every 10 years for owner-occupied homes, or when buying/selling a property.

Businesses

Commercial properties should be tested every 5 years, or every 3 years for high-risk environments.

Our EICR Process

1

Visual Inspection

Checking visible electrical equipment for obvious defects

2

Testing & Measurements

Using calibrated test equipment to check circuits and safety devices

3

Documentation

Detailed report with findings, observations, and recommendations

4

Certification

Official EICR certificate if installation is satisfactory

Frequently Asked Questions

How long does an EICR take?

Typically 2-4 hours depending on the size and complexity of the property. Larger properties may take longer.

What happens if my EICR fails?

We'll provide a detailed report of any issues found. Many problems can be fixed on the same day, allowing for re-certification.

Do you provide same-day certificates?

Yes, if the installation passes inspection, certificates are typically provided on the same day as the testing.

What areas do you cover?

We cover all of Somerset including Taunton, Yeovil, Bridgwater, Frome, Wells, Glastonbury and surrounding areas.
